moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4: I move up my centre pawns to free my queen and bishops...
moves.4... Nc6: ...he develops his to attack my queen...
moves.5. Bb5: ...I develop my bishop and pin the knight down...
moves.5... Bd7: ...he brings out his bishop to unpin it...
moves.6. Bxc6: ...so I remove the knight and its threat to the queen...
moves.7. O-O: ...and castle kingside to bring my rook into play if needs be.
moves.7... Qe7: His queen adds pressure to my pawn on e4...
moves.8. Nc3: ...so I contest it with my knight.
moves.8... b6 9. Bg5: Now I move up my other bishop to attack the queen...
moves.10... O-O-O 11. Nd5: Now I move up my knight to attack the queen...
moves.11... Qe6: ...but he moves her out of the way...
moves.13... Qf7 14. Bxa7: Now my surviving bishop removes his far pawn...
moves.14... Re8 15. Nb6+: ...so my knight can attack the king, whilst protected from the pawn by the queen.
moves.15... Kd8: He moves him onto the only possible space...
moves.16... Ke7: Again, there is only one space to move...
moves.18... Kxd6: ...but removing the knight with the king...
moves.19. Rad1+: ...allows one of my rooks to force the king to the e-file...
moves.20... Ke7 21. Bc5#: ...and the bishop can move in for the kill.
